about_the_game:
Rail Fights is a multiplayer shooter for 1-8 players that adds a competitive edge to the simplicity of old-school arcade games. Players ride their tanks on a closed oval rail, bump other tanks around, capture different launchers, shoot and total opponents on the other side of the arena.

Solo or Team

Fight solo against 7 other solo players, team up with a friend as a duo to face off against 3 other teams of two or join forces with three other players to form a team of four and compete against another team.

Multiplayer

Enjoy Rail Fights locally with friends on your device, playing against each other or AI. We're keeping an eye on player interest and may add online features, like casual and ranked matches, in the future based on demand.

Single Player

Not in the party mood? You can always enjoy single-player mode against AI opponents and aim to top the leaderboards.

Easy to Play, Hard to Master

Game controls are simple and intuitive just like old school arcade games, allowing everyone to start playing Rail Fights right away and enjoy it. However, the specific shape of the arena, combined with the tank’s speed, target movements and missile speed can make aiming and timing shots counterintuitive at times. Only practice could make Rail Fighters overcome this challenge.

Capture Your Launcher

Change your tank’s firepower by hitting and capturing launcher tokens that appear in the arena. Different launchers, such as cannons, rockets, lasers, and grenade launchers, come with varying shooting speeds, cooldown times, and destructive power, requiring different strategies. The better the launcher, the scarcer it is, so try to be the first to capture one.

Bumper Compression

If other tanks are pushing you around by force, just hold for a bit for your tank’s bumpers to get compressed enough and kick them away from you; The tanks will be stalled for a short period after getting kicked.
